message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DC, cs.SI, cs.NI. 

The paper deals with the construction of minimum storage regenerating (MSR) codes, which are a type of erasure codes used in distributed storage systems. This falls under the category of information theory (cs.IT). The paper also uses techniques from graph theory and matrix theory, which are relevant to the sub-categories of data structures (cs.DS) and distributed computing (cs.DC). The paper also discusses the access-optimality of the codes, which is related to the sub-category of social and information networks (cs.SI). Finally, the paper deals with the field size of the codes, which is relevant to the sub-category of networking and internet architecture (cs.NI).
